you can safely remove -dev packages, they are only used when you manually compile things...
remove whatever gets in your way for what you want to do now :)
dpkg --get-selections | grep -v deinstall | grep -- -dev | awk '{print $1}' | xargs apt-get remove --purge
dpkg --get-selections | grep -v deinstall | grep -- '-dev[^a-z] ' | awk '{print $1}' | xargs apt-get remove --purge
